intro: Xiphopterella devolii, commonly known as the Devol's xiphopterella, is a rare and small flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
